fields.text: I find my inspiration in myself.
fields.author: Thelonious Monk

fields.text: The piano ain't got no wrong notes.
fields.author: Thelonious Monk

fields.text: After two takes you're imitating yourself.
fields.author: Thelonious Monk

fields.text: Talking about music is like dancing about architecture.
fields.author: Thelonious Monk

fields.text: I don't have a definition of Jazz. You're just supposed to know it when you hear it.
fields.author: Thelonious Monk

fields.text: I like to sleep. There is no set time of day for sleep. You sleep when you're tired & that's all there is to it.
fields.author: Thelonious Monk
Wes Montgomery
fields.text: When I got pretty good I went on the road with a group. We starved.

fields.author: Wes Montgomery
fields.text: Regardless of what you play, the biggest thing is keeping the feel going.

fields.author: Wes Montgomery
fields.text: To me, the guitar cuts through. It carries more than the organ, but the organ has got more guts.

fields.author: Wes Montgomery
fields.text: I never practice my guitar. From time to time I just open the case & throw in a piece of raw meat.

fields.author: Pat Metheny
fields.text: Listening is the key to everything good in music.

fields.author: Pat Metheny
fields.text: Jazz music will continue to thrive, possibly in unexpected ways.

fields.author: Pat Metheny
fields.text: Jazz is an idea that is more powerful than the details of its history.

fields.author: Pat Metheny
fields.text: My first relationship to any kind of musical situation is as a listener.

fields.author: Pat Metheny
fields.text: The beauty of Jazz is that it's malleable. People address it to suit their own personalities.

fields.author: Pat Metheny
fields.text: It is Jazz's very nature to change, to develop & adapt to the circumstances of its environment.

fields.author: Pat Metheny
fields.text: I don't worry too much about the fundamentalist principles that are in almost any discussion about Jazz.

fields.author: Pat Metheny
fields.text: Jazz demands that you bring to it things that are valuable to you, that are personal to you.

fields.author: Pat Metheny
fields.text: Jazz is not something that can be defined through blunt instruments. It is much more poetic than that.

fields.author: Pat Metheny
fields.text: People sometimes say it takes a long time to become a Jazz fan, but for me it took about five seconds.

fields.author: Charlie Parker
fields.text: I can play all I know in eight bars.

fields.author: Charlie Parker
fields.text: You've got to learn your instrument.

fields.author: Charlie Parker
fields.text: Don't play the saxophone. Let it play you.

fields.author: Charlie Parker
fields.text: If you don't live it, it won't come out of your horn.

fields.author: Charlie Parker
fields.text: It's not all smoke and mirrors. Some of it comes from books.

fields.author: Charlie Parker
fields.text: Once I could play what I heard inside me, that's when I was born.

fields.author: Charlie Parker
fields.text: Master your instrument, master the music & then forget all that & just play.

fields.author: Charlie Parker
fields.text: I kept thinking there's bound to be something else? I could hear it sometimes, but I couldn't play it.

fields.author: Charlie Parker
fields.text: They teach you there's a boundary line to music. But, man, there's no boundary line to art.

fields.author: Charlie Parker
fields.text: Music is your experience, your thoughts, your wisdom. If you don't live it, it won't come out of your horn.

fields.author: Louis Armstrong
fields.text: What we play is life.

fields.author: Louis Armstrong
fields.text: You blows who you is.

fields.author: Louis Armstrong
fields.text: Man, if you gotta ask you'll never know

fields.author: Louis Armstrong
fields.text: I don't need words. It's all in the phrasing.

fields.author: Louis Armstrong
fields.text: Never play anything the same way twice.

fields.author: Louis Armstrong
fields.text: We all do 'do, re, mi' but you got to find the other notes yourself.

fields.author: Louis Armstrong
fields.text: Musicians don't retire; they stop when there's no more music in them.

fields.author: Louis Armstrong
fields.text: There is two kinds of music, the good & the bad. I play the good kind.

fields.author: Louis Armstrong
fields.text: Man, all music is folk music. You ain't never heard no horse sing a song, have you?

fields.author: Louis Armstrong
fields.text: Hot can be cool & cool can be hot & each can be both. But hot or cool man, Jazz is Jazz.

fields.author: Louis Armstrong
fields.text: If I don't practice for a day, I know it... for two days, the critics know it... three days, the public knows it.
